meanings.definition: The act of writing or adding something between the lines of a text.
meanings.sent1: She carefully made interlineations in her book to highlight important points.
meanings.sent2: The professor's interlineations in the textbook helped the students understand the complex topic.
meanings.sent3: The detective found mysterious interlineations in the suspect's diary, revealing a hidden message.
meanings.sent4: Her interlineations in the contract added clarity to the legal jargon, making it easier to comprehend.
meanings.sent5: The interlineations in the ancient manuscript provided valuable insights into the culture of that era.

meanings.definition: A written or printed note inserted between lines of text.
meanings.sent1: He found a helpful interlineation in the margin of the document.
meanings.sent2: The editor added an interlineation to clarify the meaning of the paragraph.
meanings.sent3: The interlineation in the recipe book reminded her to buy fresh ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The interlineation in the letter contained a secret code only they understood.
meanings.sent5: The interlineation in the map pointed out the hidden treasure's location.

meanings.definition: The process of adding extra lines to a document or text.
meanings.sent1: The interlineations in the report made it easier to read by spacing out the text.
meanings.sent2: During the editing phase, she focused on the interlineations to improve the document's layout.
meanings.sent3: The printer mistakenly added interlineations to the document, causing confusion among readers.
meanings.sent4: Her creative interlineations transformed the plain document into an engaging piece of art.
meanings.sent5: The interlineations in the poem created a visual rhythm that enhanced the reader's experience.
